intro: Tanarius trilobus, commonly known as the three-lobed burrweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each leaflet having a distinct three-lobed shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by spiny, three-lobed fruits. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. Due to its unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
